Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-orange pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, very worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.180)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36417) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36417)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 274 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13463 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
